intro: Stenandriopsis gossypina, commonly known as the cottonleaf stenandriopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. Stenandriopsis gossypina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
